intro: Guettarda rhabdocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaf guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
